question: Assume that the lengths of the sides opposite to the three interior angles A, B, and C of triangle ABC are a, b, and c respectively. If b=\sqrt(2), c=2, and (\sqrt(3)sinA+cosA)/(\sqrt(3)cosA-sinA) = tan(5\pi /12), then find the length of a?

intermediate-results.result: A+\pi/6 = 5\pi/12 + k\pi where k belongs to integer set.
